  <style id="superwise_options_style-inline-css" type="text/css">
   .icon-top-bar {
    display:inline;
}

.menu-label {
    background: #ffbc59;
    border-radius: 2px;
    color: #fff;
    font-family: "Libre Franklin";
    font-size: 3em;
    font-weight: 900;
    margin-left: 10px;
    padding: 5px 6px 5px 6px;
    position: relative;
    top: -3px;
}

/* Menu icons */
.wh-menu-main > li {
    width: 181px;
}
.wh-menu-main > li a i {
    display: inline-block;
    font-size: 25px;
    width: 45px;
    height: 45px;
    text-align: center;
    padding-top: 9px;
    position: relative;
    border-radius: 50%;
    margin-top: -3px;
    margin-right: 9px;
    top: 4px;
    margin-bottom: 7px;
}
.wh-menu-main > li:first-child {
    width: auto;
    margin-left: -15px;
}
.wh-menu-main > li:last-child {
    background-color: #ffc600;
    float: right !important;
} 
.wh-menu-main > li:last-child a,
.wh-menu-main > li:last-child a:hover {
    color: #fff;
}

/* Menu icon */
.wh-menu-main > li  .icon-edsuiteic_home_black {
    font-size: 30px;
    color: #cbcbcb;
    margin-right: -5px;
    margin-left: -2px;
    padding-top: 4px;
    top: 6px;
}
.wh-menu-main > li a:hover .icon-edsuiteic_home_black {


}

/* Menu icon */
.wh-menu-main > li  .icon-edsuiteic_notifications {
    background: #e53935;
    color: #fff;
}
.wh-menu-main > li a:hover .icon-edsuiteic_notifications {
    background: #c31814;

}
/* Menu icon */
.wh-menu-main > li .icon-edsuitemedal-number-one{
    background: #f8a724;
    color: #fff;
}
.wh-menu-main > li a:hover .icon-edsuitemedal-number-one {
    background: #d78603;
}
/* Menu icon */
.wh-menu-main > li .icon-edsuiteic_event_note {
    background: #4caf50;
    color: #fff;
}
.wh-menu-main > li a:hover .icon-edsuiteic_event_note {
    background: #2e9133;
}
/* Menu icon */
.wh-menu-main > li .fa-pencil {
    background: #1d87e4;
    color: #fff;
}
.wh-menu-main > li a:hover .fa-pencil {
    background: #2e9133;
}
/* Menu icon */
.wh-menu-main > li .icon-edsuiteic_person {
    background: #1d87e4;
    color: #fff;
}
.wh-menu-main > li a:hover .icon-edsuiteic_person {
    background: #0068c5;
}
/* Menu icon */
.wh-menu-main > li .icon-edsuiteic_account_balance {
    background: #7d57c1;
    color: #fff;
}
.wh-menu-main > li a:hover .icon-edsuiteic_account_balance {
    background: #5c359f;
}
/* Menu icon */
.wh-menu-main > li .icon-edsuiteic_flag {
    background: #fff;
    color: #ffc600;
}
.wh-menu-main > li a:hover .icon-edsuiteic_flag {
    background: #ffd95b;
    color: #fff;
}

          <br/>
         </h4>
         <div class="vc_separator wpb_content_element vc_separator_align_center vc_sep_width_100 vc_sep_border_width_3 vc_sep_pos_align_center vc_separator_no_text">

          <div class="vc_toggle_title">
           <h4>
            Cooperation and Communication Skills
           </h4>
           <i class="vc_toggle_icon">
           </i>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_toggle_content">
           <ol>
            <li style="text-align: justify;">
             To present personal research, thoughts, ideas and opinions of proposals within professional activities in a suitable way, both written and orally.
            </li>
            <li style="text-align: justify;">
             To communicate with specialists and non-specialists new methodologies and approaches, underlying basic thoughts, experiences and opinions and development within the specialization on play, toys, early childhood education, intercultural studies, and early second language acquisition.
            </li>
            <li style="text-align: justify;">
             To interact with early childhood teachers from different countries using English as a second language.
            </li>
            <li style="text-align: justify;">
             To participate in a network of early childhood teachers and researchers in this or close disciplines to increase knowledge on current research, development and new strategies on play, toys, early childhood education, intercultural studies, and early second language acquisition.
            </li>
           </ol>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="vc_toggle vc_toggle_default vc_toggle_color_default vc_toggle_size_lg vc_toggle_active wpb_animate_when_almost_visible wpb_fadeInUp fadeInUp">
          <div class="vc_toggle_title">
           <h4>

           </h4>
           <i class="vc_toggle_icon">
           </i>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_toggle_content">
           <ol>
            <li style="text-align: justify;">
             To develop and execute original scientific or teaching research on play, toys, early childhood education, intercultural studies, and early second language acquisition,
            </li>
            <li style="text-align: justify;">
             To apply innovative ideas within the previous research units.
            </li>
           </ol>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="vc_toggle vc_toggle_default vc_toggle_color_default vc_toggle_size_lg vc_toggle_active wpb_animate_when_almost_visible wpb_fadeInUp fadeInUp">
          <div class="vc_toggle_title">
           <h4>

           </h4>
           <i class="vc_toggle_icon">
           </i>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_toggle_content">
           <ol>
            <li style="text-align: justify;">
             To be able to carry out research in their own countries and/or in international teams.
            </li>
            <li style="text-align: justify;">
             To take an active and independent role in early childhood education, higher education, research, and administration, as well as to use the most recent information.
            </li>
            <li style="text-align: justify;">
             To be able to take up a job in for early childhood education centres and museums (among others), both for teaching and management, or even to obtain the leadership on related projects.
            </li>
            <li style="text-align: justify;">
             To solve problems in teaching and academic environments.
            </li>
            <li style="text-align: justify;">
             To develop new methodologies, approaches, concepts and tools for early childhood education centres.
            </li>
            <li style="text-align: justify;">
             To understand and know the basic foundations of teaching and professional ethics, and good practice in the field of early childhood education.
            </li>
            <li style="text-align: justify;">
             To empower students with the ability to self-employment. Formation of consortia or multidisciplinary teaching groups for both formal and non-formal education centres creation in the early childhood education field.
            </li>
           </ol>

    width: 181px;
}

}

}
.wh-menu-main > li:last-child {
    background-color: #ffc600;

}

}

}

}

}

    background: #c31814;

}

    background: #f8a724;
    color: #fff;
}
.wh-menu-main > li a:hover .icon-edsuitemedal-number-one {
    background: #d78603;
}
/* Menu icon */
.wh-menu-main > li .icon-edsuiteic_event_note {
    background: #4caf50;
    color: #fff;
}
.wh-menu-main > li a:hover .icon-edsuiteic_event_note {
    background: #2e9133;
}

.wh-menu-main > li .fa-pencil {
    background: #1d87e4;

}

    background: #2e9133;
}

}

}

}

  <div class="cbp-row wh-content">
   <div class="cbp-container">
    <div class="entry-content one whole wh-padding">
     <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1537376647778">
      <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
       <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1489757662264">
        <div class="wpb_wrapper">
         <h4 class="vc_custom_heading wpb_animate_when_almost_visible wpb_fadeIn fadeIn" style="font-size: 30px;color: #000000;line-height: 43px;text-align: left">
          Description
         </h4>
         <div class="vc_separator wpb_content_element vc_separator_align_center vc_sep_width_100 vc_sep_border_width_3 vc_sep_pos_align_center vc_separator_no_text wpb_animate_when_almost_visible wpb_fadeIn fadeIn wpb_animate_when_almost_visible wpb_fadeIn fadeIn">
          <span class="vc_sep_holder vc_sep_holder_l">
           <span class="vc_sep_line" style="border-color:#f8a724;">
           </span>
          </span>
          <span class="vc_sep_holder vc_sep_holder_r">
           <span class="vc_sep_line" style="border-color:#f8a724;">
           </span>
          </span>
         </div>
         <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element wpb_animate_when_almost_visible wpb_fadeInUp fadeInUp vc_custom_1537425799861">
          <div class="wpb_wrapper">
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            The
            <strong>
             Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree
            </strong>
            at the heart of this proposal focuses on
            <strong>
             Play, Education, Toys and Language
            </strong>
            (hereinafter PETaL). Its design is based on the best practices and expertise of the participating institutions. It is built by three programme country institutions [the University of Cordoba (Spain), the Polytechnic Institute of Lisbon (Portugal) and Marmara University (Turkey)] on a unique framework for the delivery of an EMJMD programme. The study programme, including the curriculum content, will be jointly delivered by the teaching staff of all the institutions involved plus the enriching contribution of expert guest scholars from all over the world (e.g. the USA, Africa, South America, and Europe).
           </p>
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            Each of the programme countries will deliver
            <strong>
             30 ECTS of the taught credits
            </strong>
            , resulting in a
            <strong>
             fully integrated curriculum of 120 ECTS
            </strong>
            <strong>
             (90 ECTS plus 30 ECTS Master Thesis)
            </strong>
            . PETaL EMJMD is an innovative and unique course, which will enhance the attractiveness of the European Higher Education Area (EHEA).
           </p>
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            <strong>
             Play, toys and games; intercultural education (IE); second language acquisition (ESLA), and early childhood education (ECE) are the key topics of PETaL
            </strong>
            , which until now have only been offered in isolation. By embedding these topics in a single, coherent programme we offer both European and international students the chance to develop a unique portfolio of skills and knowledge within a programme of study that ranges over three different countries (ES, PT and TR).
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid wpb_animate_when_almost_visible wpb_fadeInUp fadeInUp vc_custom_1537378838418 vc_column-gap-35">
      <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-4">
       <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1537377676181">
        <div class="wpb_wrapper">
         <div class="scp-circles vc_align_center">
          <div class="circle-main" style="background-color: #59c6e8">
           <h4 style="color: #ffffff">
            Students
           </h4>
           <h3 style="color: #ffffff">
            61
           </h3>
          </div>
          <div class="circle-middle" style="background-color: #ffc600">
          </div>

     <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1537376654168">
      <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
       <div class="vc_column-inner">
        <div class="wpb_wrapper">
         <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element wpb_animate_when_almost_visible wpb_fadeInUp fadeInUp vc_custom_1537426006996">
          <div class="wpb_wrapper">
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            The
            <strong>
             course modules
            </strong>
            are designed to intertwine pedagogical aspects with culture in order to
            <strong>
             emphasize the importance of culture in the practices of game and play within a plurilingual and intercultural context
            </strong>
            , such as it is 21
            <sup>
             st
            </sup>
            century society. The impact of culture on education in general, and on Early Childhood Education and child development in particular, has always been an interesting area for research; however, a programme like PETaL EMJMD that incorporates play, toys, language and intercultural education has not been introduced up to now. Through toys and play, children explore and know the rules and symbols of their communities, as well as recreate roles and situations that reflect their sociocultural and 21
            <sup>
             st
            </sup>
            century plurilingual world.
           </p>
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            As a result, they learn how to subordinate desires to social rules, cooperate with others willingly, and engage in socially appropriate behaviour. Given all sociological factors and when they are evaluated together with the psychological ones, we can see that there is a current need for action to increase the amount and quality of play provided to children. Since discrepancies are observed between urban and rural areas and between different cultures, there is also need for action to start programs where cultures can learn and take advantage from the experiences of each other. In summary, the
            <strong>
             PETaL EMJMD
            </strong>
            reflects a common and integrated approach by the consortium that
            <strong>
             will provide graduates with an internationally recognised joint degree
            </strong>
            .
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>

     <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1489757648863 vc_column-gap-10">

       <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1489757736243">
        <div class="wpb_wrapper">
         <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1537426976289">
          <div class="wpb_wrapper">
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            1. To enable collaborative and cooperative exchanges of knowledge, understanding and practice between partner institutions and students and across a range of international contexts bringing attitudes within Europe closer together and increasing employability within the broader European context.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6">
       <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1489757740544">
        <div class="wpb_wrapper">
         <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1537427405460">
          <div class="wpb_wrapper">
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            4. To provide students with the theoretical knowledge and understanding and the practical skills to plan, implement and evaluate practice-and-data based enquiry, with a view to promoting the continual improvement and development of practices within the workplace.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1514462760870">
      <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6">
       <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1489757745160">
        <div class="wpb_wrapper">
         <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1537427345139">
          <div class="wpb_wrapper">
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            2. To enhance the professional skills required to influence good practice in ECE across Europe and internationally, enabling students and staff to share and extend good practice through an extended project and communicate more easily with those from cultures other than their own.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6">
       <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1489757766209">
        <div class="wpb_wrapper">
         <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1537427420867">
          <div class="wpb_wrapper">
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            5. To develop students’ competences to empower them to intervene in both formal and non-formal educational contexts, becoming agents for change within their own work settings and thus meeting the demands of a changing, complex, multilingual and intercultural society.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1514462760870">
      <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6">
       <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1489757745160">
        <div class="wpb_wrapper">
         <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1537427385090">
          <div class="wpb_wrapper">
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            3. To enable students (and staff) to engage in meaningful research and knowledge transfer activities for the enhancement of professional development and entrepreneurship in ECE, to meet the needs of the ECE teachers, ECE schools and society in general, which require specialized training in diverse systems across Europe (ref. London 2007 Conference).
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6">
       <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1489757766209">
        <div class="wpb_wrapper">
         <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1537427439588">
          <div class="wpb_wrapper">
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            6. The joint focus on toys and play, culture and linguistic competence in an Early Childhood Education context enables our project to embrace core established traditions and sensitively encourage within the family and future generations a greater openness to acceptance of difference, working towards a future society whose members have a greater shared identity.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>

    width: 181px;
}

    font-size: 25px;

    padding-top: 9px;

}
.wh-menu-main > li:first-child {

    margin-left: -15px;
}
.wh-menu-main > li:last-child {
    background-color: #ffc600;

}

.wh-menu-main > li:last-child a:hover {
    color: #fff;
}

}

}

}

    background: #c31814;

}
/* Menu icon */
.wh-menu-main > li .icon-edsuitemedal-number-one{
    background: #f8a724;
    color: #fff;
}

    background: #d78603;
}

.wh-menu-main > li .icon-edsuiteic_event_note {
    background: #4caf50;
    color: #fff;
}
.wh-menu-main > li a:hover .icon-edsuiteic_event_note {
    background: #2e9133;
}
/* Menu icon */
.wh-menu-main > li .fa-pencil {
    background: #1d87e4;

}

    background: #2e9133;
}

}

}

    background: #fff;

    <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1537807278595 vc_row-has-fill">
     <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6 vc_col-has-fill">
      <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1537806601125">
       <div class="wpb_wrapper">
        <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1537807463578">
         <div class="wpb_wrapper">
          <p style="text-align: justify;">
           PETaL EMJMD
           <strong>
            first semester
           </strong>
           , entitled ‘General Introduction’, will be delivered at the Universidad de Córdoba (Spain). Its main goal is to provide students with the fundamentals of the four areas of expertise included in this EMJMD (that is, the psychology of children play; ECE; IE; and ESLA).
          </p>
          <p style="text-align: justify;">
           PETaL
           <strong>
            second semester courses
           </strong>
           will be delivered at the Instituto Politécnico de Lisboa (Portugal) that will complement and enrich students’ knowledge about the role of play and toys for learning in ECE in different cultures.
          </p>
          <p style="text-align: justify;">
           <strong>
            Third semester courses
           </strong>
           are offered by Marmara University (Turkey), highly specialized in the Sociology of play and children.
          </p>
          <p style="text-align: justify;">
           <strong>
            The fourth semester
           </strong>
           will be devoted to the planning and writing of the Master’s Thesis (30 ECTS), which can take place at any of the three participant Universities in collaboration with the associated partners. A wide range of possible topics is available for MT projects carefully designed to ensure relevant skills and subject training. The list of topics offered will be yearly updated.
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>

         <div class="wpb_single_image wpb_content_element vc_align_left vc_custom_1538042574347">
          <figure class="wpb_wrapper vc_figure">

            <img alt="" class="vc_single_image-img attachment-full" height="447" sizes="(max-width: 1110px) 100vw, 1110px" src="https://web.em-petal.eu/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/erasmus-mundus_cabecera.png" srcset="https://web.em-petal.eu/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/erasmus-mundus_cabecera.png 1110w, https://web.em-petal.eu/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/erasmus-mundus_cabecera-300x121.png 300w, https://web.em-petal.eu/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/erasmus-mundus_cabecera-1024x412.png 1024w" width="1110"/>
           </a>
          </figure>
         </div>
         <h4 class="vc_custom_heading" style="text-align: left">
          Erasmus Mundus student scholarships
         </h4>
         <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1581437270191">
          <div class="wpb_wrapper">
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            <strong>
             Scholarship applications for every intake will open on 15 September, with the Application for the Programme.
            </strong>
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1581437332977">
          <div class="wpb_wrapper">
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            EMJMD student scholarships can be offered to students from any region of the world. The scholarships’ terms depend on the student’s country of origin/residence.
            <strong>
             Scholarship holders must state that they will not be doubly funded for the same period.
            </strong>
            <strong>
             You must submit a declaration on oath.
            </strong>
           </p>
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            The EMJMD student scholarship includes:
           </p>
           <ul>
            <li style="text-align: justify;">
             A contribution to the student participation costs (including tuition fees, full
             <strong>
              insurance coverage
             </strong>
             and any other mandatory costs related to the students’ participation in the EMJMD study programme.
            </li>
            <li style="text-align: justify;">
             A contribution to student travel and installation costs.
            </li>
            <li style="text-align: justify;">
             A monthly subsistence allowance for the entire duration of the EMJMD study programme.
            </li>
           </ul>
           <p>
            <strong>
             <span class="mceNonEditable">
             </span>
            </strong>
           </p>
           <table border="1">
            <tbody>
             <tr>
              <td style="text-align: center;">
               Contribution to the participation costs
              </td>
              <td>
               Up to 4,500 € per year per scholarship holder from a Programme Country.
               <p>
                Up to 9,000 € per year per scholarship holder from a Partner Country.
               </p>
               <p>
                Any amount in excess of these maximum contributions must be covered by the participating organisations and cannot be charged to the scholarship holder.
               </p>
              </td>
             </tr>
             <tr>
              <td style="text-align: center;">
               Contribution to the travel and installation costs
              </td>
              <td>
               1,000 € per year per scholarship holder
               <strong>
                resident
               </strong>
               of a Programme country.
               <p>
                2,000 € per year for travel costs + 1,000 € for installation costs for a scholarship holder
                <strong>
                 resident
                </strong>
                in a Partner country whose location is situated at less than 4,000 km from the EMJMD coordinating HEI.
               </p>
               <p>
                3,000 € per year for travel costs + 1,000 € for installation costs for a scholarship
                <strong>
                 resident
                </strong>
                in a Partner country whose location is situated at 4.000km or more from the EMJMD coordinating HEI.
               </p>
               <p>
                Distance is calculated by the Consortium using the
                <strong>
                 EACEA calculator
                </strong>
                (available below).
               </p>
              </td>
             </tr>
             <tr>
              <td style="text-align: center;">
               Contribution to subsistence costs
              </td>
              <td>
               1,000 € per month for the entire duration of the EMJMD study programme (24 months maximum).
               <p>
                Contribution to subsistence costs will
                <strong>
                 not
                </strong>
                be given to scholarship holders for the periods of the EMJMD (study / research / placement / thesis preparation) spent in their country of residence.
               </p>
               <p>
                Contribution to subsistence costs will
                <strong>
                 not
                </strong>
                be given to Partner Country scholarship holders for periods exceeding 3 months spent in any Partner Country.
               </p>
              </td>
             </tr>
            </tbody>
           </table>
           <p>
            <em>
             Last updated 11 February 2020.
            </em>
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>

              <div class="vc_tta-panel vc_active" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="general-principles">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#general-principles">
                  <i class="vc_tta-icon vc-material vc-material-date_range">
                  </i>
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   General Principles
                   <br/>
                   & Regulations
                  </span>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="vc_separator wpb_content_element vc_separator_align_center vc_sep_width_100 vc_sep_border_width_2 vc_sep_pos_align_center vc_separator_no_text vc_sep_color_grey vc_custom_1538150027064 vc_custom_1538150027064">
                 <span class="vc_sep_holder vc_sep_holder_l">
                  <span class="vc_sep_line">
                  </span>
                 </span>
                 <span class="vc_sep_holder vc_sep_holder_r">
                  <span class="vc_sep_line">
                  </span>
                 </span>
                </div>
                <div class="vc_empty_space" style="height: 5px">
                 <span class="vc_empty_space_inner">
                 </span>
                </div>
                <h5 class="vc_custom_heading vc_custom_1538151187543" style="font-size: 20px;line-height: 26px;text-align: left">
                 General Principles & Regulations
                </h5>
                <div class="vc_empty_space" style="height: 5px">
                 <span class="vc_empty_space_inner">
                 </span>
                </div>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1538150665170">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <ul>
                   <li style="text-align: justify;">
                    EMJMD student scholarships cover the entire duration of the Master course and are awarded exclusively for full-time enrolment in the course.  Scholarship candidates must have already obtained a first higher education degree or demonstrate a recognised equivalent level of learning according to national rules and legislation in place. Candidates who will only obtain their first higher education degree at the end of the academic year preceding the EMJMD intake can nevertheless apply for a scholarship and can be selected by the consortium, under the condition that the student obtains the required degree prior to the beginning of the Master course.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1538150798604">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <ul>
                   <li style="text-align: justify;">
                    Students who are former Action 1 Erasmus Mundus Master/Doctoral Course scholarship holders are not eligible for an additional EMJMD scholarship. Successful applicants cannot benefit from another EU grant while pursuing the EMJMD scholarship studies.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1538150805196">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <ul>
                   <li style="text-align: justify;">
                    EMJMD scholarship holders must spend at least two complete mobility periods in at least two of the consortium’s full HEI partners which are located in different Programme Countries. Each of these mandatory mobility periods must include a volume of study/research or equivalent corresponding to at least 30 ECTS.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1538150817893">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <ul>
                   <li style="text-align: justify;">
                    The mandatory mobility periods cannot be replaced by virtual mobility neither can they take place in institutions outside the consortium.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1538150823869">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <ul>
                   <li style="text-align: justify;">
                    Additional study/research/thesis preparation/placement periods can take place in other participating organisations in the consortium (partner and associated partner) under the condition that the activities concerned are implemented under the direct supervision of the consortium partner.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1538150830599">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <ul>
                   <li style="text-align: justify;">
                    Contribution to subsistence costs will
                    <strong>
                     not
                    </strong>
                    be given to scholarship holders for periods of the EMJMD spent in their country of residence.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="vc_empty_space" style="height: 5px">
                 <span class="vc_empty_space_inner">
                 </span>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="nationality">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#nationality">
                  <i class="vc_tta-icon vc-material vc-material-library_books">
                  </i>
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Nationality, residency
                   <br/>
                   & The 12 Month Rule
                  </span>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="vc_separator wpb_content_element vc_separator_align_center vc_sep_width_100 vc_sep_border_width_2 vc_sep_pos_align_center vc_separator_no_text vc_sep_color_grey vc_custom_1538045788580 vc_custom_1538045788580">
                 <span class="vc_sep_holder vc_sep_holder_l">
                  <span class="vc_sep_line">
                  </span>
                 </span>
                 <span class="vc_sep_holder vc_sep_holder_r">
                  <span class="vc_sep_line">
                  </span>
                 </span>
                </div>
                <div class="vc_empty_space" style="height: 5px">
                 <span class="vc_empty_space_inner">
                 </span>
                </div>
                <h5 class="vc_custom_heading vc_custom_1538152480965" style="font-size: 20px;line-height: 26px;text-align: left">
                 Nationality, residency & The 12 Month Rule
                </h5>
                <div class="vc_empty_space" style="height: 5px">
                 <span class="vc_empty_space_inner">
                 </span>
                </div>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1538152192570">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p style="text-align: justify;">
                   Scholarships are dependent on both nationality and residency. Students with a double nationality (of a Partner and of a Programme Country) must specify the nationality under which they submit their scholarship application. When determining the contribution to
                   <strong>
                    participation costs
                   </strong>
                   , the consortium defines the student category – either Programme country or Partner country. The definition of the student category depends on their nationality and on whether the student resided in a Programme country for more than 12 months over the last five years before applying (applicable only to students with Partner country nationality). Therefore:
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li style="text-align: justify;">
                    Students whose nationality is one of the Erasmus+ Programme countries count as Programme country students and should apply using the Programme country application form.
                   </li>
                   <li style="text-align: justify;">
                    Students whose nationality is one of the Erasmus+ Partner countries and who are not residents nor have carried out their main activity (studies, training or work) for more than a total of 12 months over the last five years in a Programme country are considered as Partner country students. The five year reference period for this 12 month rule is calculated backwards from the submission deadline (ie the 5 year period from 09 January 2014 to 09 January 2019). Apply using the Partner country application form.
                   </li>
                   <li style="text-align: justify;">
                    Students whose nationality is one of the Erasmus+ Partner countries who do
                    <strong>
                     not
                    </strong>
                    fulfil the Partner country criteria defined above (12 month rule) count as Programme country students and should apply using the Programme country application form.
                   </li>
                   <li style="text-align: justify;">
                    Example: a Serbian student who lived in Germany for 13 months, 3 years before 09 January 2019 should apply as a Programme country student; a Mexican student who has been living in Spain for 11 months at 09 January 2019 (and never before in the 5 year period) should apply as a Partner country student.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1538152212778">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p style="text-align: justify;">
                   The contribution to
                   <strong>
                    travel and installation costs
                   </strong>
                   takes into account
                   <strong>
                    only
                   </strong>
                   the residence (as determined above, at 09 January 2019) of the scholarship holder regardless of the category under which the student has applied.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1538152257583">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Students offered a scholarship will be required to provide proof of residency
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    A residence certificate issued in accordance with the candidate’s municipality normal registration rules.
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    A certificate form the candidate’s place of work, study or training issued by the employer or institution in question.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1538152275599">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Both documents must have been issued within 12 months before the scholarship submission deadline.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="vc_empty_space" style="height: 5px">
                 <span class="vc_empty_space_inner">
                 </span>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>

                </h5>
                <div class="vc_empty_space" style="height: 5px">

                  <h5>
                   Selection timetable
                  </h5>
                  <table border="0" class="StripedTable">

                      </strong>

                      Online application form becomes available.
                     </td>
                    </tr>

                      </strong>

                      Deadline for ALL scholarship applicants at 23.59 GMT/UTC +1.

                </div>
                <div class="vc_separator wpb_content_element vc_separator_align_center vc_sep_width_100 vc_sep_border_width_2 vc_sep_pos_align_center vc_separator_no_text vc_sep_color_grey">
                 <span class="vc_sep_holder vc_sep_holder_l">
                  <span class="vc_sep_line">
                  </span>
                 </span>
                 <span class="vc_sep_holder vc_sep_holder_r">
                  <span class="vc_sep_line">
                  </span>
                 </span>
                </div>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <h5>
                   Eligibility check
                  </h5>
                  <p style="text-align: justify;">
                   All applications are subject to an eligibility check which covers all aspects of the application: respect of the application deadline, completeness of the application file, eligibility of the candidate in relation to the Erasmus Mundus criteria. Applicants who fail to provide necessary documentation by the appropriate deadline will be excluded from the application procedure and will be informed of the specific reason for ineligibility.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="vc_separator wpb_content_element vc_separator_align_center vc_sep_width_100 vc_sep_border_width_2 vc_sep_pos_align_center vc_separator_no_text vc_sep_color_grey">
                 <span class="vc_sep_holder vc_sep_holder_l">
                  <span class="vc_sep_line">
                  </span>
                 </span>
                 <span class="vc_sep_holder vc_sep_holder_r">
                  <span class="vc_sep_line">
                  </span>
                 </span>
                </div>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <h5>
                   Selection criteria
                  </h5>
                  <p>
                   The PETaL EMJMD consortium selection committee assesses each application according to the following criteria:
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Academic merit (e.g. relevance and level of academic qualifications)
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Level of English
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Supporting personal statement
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Relevant research and professional experiences or interests
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="vc_btn3-container vc_btn3-center">
                 <a class="vc_general vc_btn3 vc_btn3-size-md vc_btn3-shape-rounded vc_btn3-style-classic vc_btn3-icon-left vc_btn3-color-default" href="https://web.em-petal.eu/application-process/" title="">
                  <i class="vc_btn3-icon fa fa-star-o">
                  </i>
                  Application Process
                 </a>
                </div>
                <section class="vc_cta3-container">
                 <div class="vc_general vc_cta3 vc_cta3-style-classic vc_cta3-shape-rounded vc_cta3-align-left vc_cta3-color-classic vc_cta3-icon-size-md">
                  <div class="vc_cta3_content-container">
                   <div class="vc_cta3-content">
                    <header class="vc_cta3-content-header">
                     <h4 class="vc_custom_heading" style="font-size: 20px;line-height: 22px">
                      Important
                     </h4>
                    </header>
                    <p style="text-align: justify;">
                     When a main list scholarship student withdraws, he/she is replaced by the first eligible candidate on the reserve list. In this particular case, the eligibility criterion concerns the nationality of the reserve list candidate and the rule concerning the presence of a maximum of three nationals from the same country among the scholarship holders in each intake. If there are already three other students with the same nationality on the main list, the consortium will have to take the next eligible candidate respecting its own ranking list (European Commission’s regulations).
                    </p>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </section>
                <div class="vc_separator wpb_content_element vc_separator_align_center vc_sep_width_100 vc_sep_border_width_2 vc_sep_pos_align_center vc_separator_no_text vc_sep_color_grey">
                 <span class="vc_sep_holder vc_sep_holder_l">
                  <span class="vc_sep_line">
                  </span>
                 </span>
                 <span class="vc_sep_holder vc_sep_holder_r">
                  <span class="vc_sep_line">
                  </span>
                 </span>
                </div>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <h5>
                   Appeal procedure for candidates who fail to secure a scholarship
                  </h5>
                  <p style="text-align: justify;">
                   All candidates will be notified of the decision of the Scholarship Selection Committee by email only in April. Candidates who do not secure a scholarship and
                   <strong>
                    who wish to appeal the decision of the scholarship selection committee must do so
                   </strong>
                   <strong>
                    in writing by the Inquiry Form available at this website within 2 weeks (14 days) from the point of notification
                   </strong>
                   by the PETaL EMJMD Consortium of their failure to obtain a scholarship. It is mandatory to select “Scholarships and Fees” option and subject should contain the words “PETaL EMJMD Scholarship Appeal”. The reasons for the appeal must be clearly stated in the email.
                  </p>
                  <p style="text-align: justify;">
                   Note: A candidate may appeal ONLY on the grounds of defective or unfair procedure by the PETaL EMJMD Scholarship Selection Committee.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                  </p>
                  <p style="text-align: justify;">
                   <em>
                    Last updated 8 July 2019.
                   </em>
                  </p>
                 </div>

}

}

}

    background: #4caf50;

}

    background: #2e9133;
}

     <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1514535535425">
      <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
       <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1489757662264">
        <div class="wpb_wrapper">
         <h3 class="vc_custom_heading vc_custom_1539601609716" style="text-align: left">
          Eligible Applicants
         </h3>
         <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1539601854183">
          <div class="wpb_wrapper">
           <p dir="ltr" style="text-align: justify;">
            PETaL EMJMD programme welcomes applications from students all around the world with a completed graduate degree preferably in areas relevant to the programme, such as education, pedagogy, intercultural studies, linguistics and sociology, among others. The programme seeks applicants with excellent academic results, strong interest in international education and proficiency in English.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="vc_separator wpb_content_element vc_separator_align_center vc_sep_width_100 vc_sep_border_width_4 vc_sep_pos_align_center vc_separator_no_text vc_sep_color_grey">
          <span class="vc_sep_holder vc_sep_holder_l">
           <span class="vc_sep_line">
           </span>
          </span>
          <span class="vc_sep_holder vc_sep_holder_r">
           <span class="vc_sep_line">
           </span>
          </span>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1514535663194">
      <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
       <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1489757662264">
        <div class="wpb_wrapper">
         <h3 class="vc_custom_heading vc_custom_1542227707073" style="text-align: left">
          Selection Criteria
         </h3>
         <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1542228134648">
          <div class="wpb_wrapper">
           <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
            <div class="wpb_wrapper">
             <p>
              The following requirements will be assessed in the selection process:
             </p>
             <ol>
              <li>
               Degree on Education (Preference Early Childhood Education).
              </li>
              <li>
               Level of English: minimum certified B2. You need to upload your official certificate of English level if you are not a native speaker of English. In this case, the selection committee will contact to you to appoint an interview to verify the level.
              </li>
              <li>
               Grades.
              </li>
              <li>
               Experience on the field.
              </li>
              <li>
               Motivation letter.
              </li>
             </ol>
             <p>
              Prepare also the following documents:
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="vc_separator wpb_content_element vc_separator_align_center vc_sep_width_100 vc_sep_border_width_4 vc_sep_pos_align_center vc_separator_no_text vc_sep_color_grey">
          <span class="vc_sep_holder vc_sep_holder_l">
           <span class="vc_sep_line">
           </span>
          </span>
          <span class="vc_sep_holder vc_sep_holder_r">
           <span class="vc_sep_line">
           </span>
          </span>
         </div>
         <div class="vc_toggle vc_toggle_rounded vc_toggle_color_orange vc_toggle_color_inverted vc_toggle_size_md vc_toggle_active">
          <div class="vc_toggle_title">
           <h2 class="vc_custom_heading" style="font-size: 22px;color: #f8a724;line-height: 22px;text-align: left">
            PROOF OF NATIONALITY
           </h2>
           <i class="vc_toggle_icon">
           </i>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_toggle_content">
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            Proof of nationality – i.e. copy of valid passport (applicants with multiple nationalities must specify at the application stage under which nationality they wish to apply). Please note that for non-EU citizens only copy of passport, not ID, is acceptable. Citizens of the EU may use their ID as proof of nationality. Upload only the page of the passport with holders´ photograph and name of the passport holder.
           </p>
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            <em>
             Applicants with multiple nationalities must specify at the application stage under which nationality they are applying. The nationality has implications for the amount of the scholarship. The declaration of nationality cannot be changed later. Applicants whose nationality is one of the Erasmus+ Partner Countries and who are not residents, nor have carried out their main activity (studies, training or work) for more than a total of 12 months over the last five years in a Programme Country, are considered as Partner Country students.
            </em>
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="vc_toggle vc_toggle_rounded vc_toggle_color_orange vc_toggle_color_inverted vc_toggle_size_md vc_toggle_active">
          <div class="vc_toggle_title">
           <h2 class="vc_custom_heading" style="font-size: 22px;color: #f8a724;line-height: 22px;text-align: left">
            PROOF OF PLACE OF RESIDENCE
           </h2>
           <i class="vc_toggle_icon">
           </i>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_toggle_content">
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            Proof of place of residence – please note, that the proof of place of residence must be issued no more than 12 months before the application submission deadline and your residency will have an implication for the calculation of the total amount of EMJMD Scholarship. You have to submit one the following documents:
           </p>
           <ul>
            <li>
             Residence certificate;
            </li>
            <li>
             Certificate or confirmation letter from the applicant’s place of work, study or training issued by the employer or institution in question;
            </li>
            <li>
             Alternatively, a receipt of the tax payment, residential rental agreement or employment contract in English where applicant’s name is clearly stated can be attached;
            </li>
            <li>
             Passport or personal ID (for EU citizens). Passport or ID is accepted as a proof of place of residence
             <strong>
              only in case it was issued no more than 12 months before the application submission deadline and if the place of residence is stated in the passport
             </strong>
             .
            </li>
           </ul>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="vc_toggle vc_toggle_rounded vc_toggle_color_orange vc_toggle_color_inverted vc_toggle_size_md vc_toggle_active">
          <div class="vc_toggle_title">
           <h2 class="vc_custom_heading" style="font-size: 22px;color: #f8a724;line-height: 22px;text-align: left">
            COPY (SCAN) OF A DIPLOMA
           </h2>
           <i class="vc_toggle_icon">
           </i>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_toggle_content">
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            Copy (scan) of a diploma proving successfully completed tertiary education (degree/master/PhD). Please note, that applicants who have not finished their degree by the year before are not eligible to apply for PETaL EMJMD.
           </p>
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            This document must include The Hague Apostille to be accepted by PETaL EMJMD Joint Academic Committee. If your country has not signed the Apostille Treaty, the document must take the seal of veracity by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of your country.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="vc_toggle vc_toggle_rounded vc_toggle_color_orange vc_toggle_color_inverted vc_toggle_size_md vc_toggle_active">
          <div class="vc_toggle_title">
           <h2 class="vc_custom_heading" style="font-size: 22px;color: #f8a724;line-height: 22px;text-align: left">
            COPY (SCAN) OF A TRANSCRIPT OF RECORDS
           </h2>
           <i class="vc_toggle_icon">
           </i>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_toggle_content">
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            Copy (scan) of a transcript of records related to the above mentioned diploma(s) including all completed courses at the time of application. If the original is in a language other than English, the certified (legally attested) copy must be in the form of a certified translation in English.
           </p>
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            This document must include The Hague Apostille to be accepted by PETaL EMJMD Joint Academic Committee. If your country has not signed the Apostille Treaty, the document must take the seal of veracity by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of your country.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="vc_toggle vc_toggle_rounded vc_toggle_color_orange vc_toggle_color_inverted vc_toggle_size_md vc_toggle_active">
          <div class="vc_toggle_title">
           <h2 class="vc_custom_heading" style="font-size: 22px;color: #f8a724;line-height: 22px;text-align: left">
            PROOF OF ENGLISH PROFICIENCY
           </h2>
           <i class="vc_toggle_icon">
           </i>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_toggle_content">
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            Proof of English proficiency –
            <strong>
             all applicants need to provide an official proof of B2 minimum English level
            </strong>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             NOTE
            </strong>
            :
           </p>
           <ul>
            <li>
             TOEFL, TOEIC, and IELTS certificates cannot be older than 2 years, CAE and CPE certificates cannot be older than 4 years.
            </li>
            <li>
             Only the language tests mentioned above are accepted. No exceptions are made. If your test is not included in this list it will not be accepted.
             <strong>
              We kindly ask you not to contact us to ask for exemption based on other test methods.
             </strong>
            </li>
            <li>
             No scores below the above stated minimums will be accepted. Please, check the official sites for these minimums.
            </li>
            <li>
             Although you have done your degree in English, an official certificate of English is required to apply if you are not a native speaker of English.
            </li>
           </ul>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="vc_toggle vc_toggle_rounded vc_toggle_color_orange vc_toggle_color_inverted vc_toggle_size_md vc_toggle_active">
          <div class="vc_toggle_title">
           <h2 class="vc_custom_heading" style="font-size: 22px;color: #f8a724;line-height: 22px;text-align: left">
            CURRICULUM VITAE
           </h2>
           <i class="vc_toggle_icon">
           </i>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_toggle_content">
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            Curriculum Vitae of maximum two A4 pages.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="vc_toggle vc_toggle_rounded vc_toggle_color_orange vc_toggle_color_inverted vc_toggle_size_md vc_toggle_active">
          <div class="vc_toggle_title">
           <h2 class="vc_custom_heading" style="font-size: 22px;color: #f8a724;line-height: 22px;text-align: left">
            MOTIVATION LETTER
           </h2>
           <i class="vc_toggle_icon">
           </i>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_toggle_content">
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            Motivation letter of maximum 700 words. The motivation letter should mainly focus on your academic interest in PETaL EMJMD programme and what you hope to achieve through studying in the programme. Additional relevant information can also be included, and you may refer to your Curriculum Vitae to save space. Please refrain from describing the PETaL programme unless doing so is relevant to your argument.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="vc_separator wpb_content_element vc_separator_align_center vc_sep_width_100 vc_sep_border_width_4 vc_sep_pos_align_center vc_separator_no_text vc_sep_color_grey">

           <p style="text-align: justify;">

            <strong>

            </strong>

            <strong>
             Scholarship holders must state that they will not be doubly funded for the same period.
            </strong>
            You must submit a
            <strong>
             declaration on oath.
            </strong>
            You can find the
            <strong>
             link to the application below this section.
            </strong>
           </p>
           <p style="text-align: justify;">

            </strong>

      <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6">
       <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1514556113455">
        <div class="wpb_wrapper">
         <h3 class="vc_custom_heading vc_custom_1542223606055" style="color: #f8a724;text-align: left">
          Application Form
         </h3>
         <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
          <div class="wpb_wrapper">
           <p>
            You will need to fill in your data for the following three sections:
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
         <h6 class="vc_custom_heading vc_custom_1548766752483" style="font-size: 18px;color: #ffffff;line-height: 24px;text-align: left">
          <strong>
           English Level
          </strong>
         </h6>
         <p class="vc_custom_heading vc_custom_1548766631638" style="font-size: 16px;text-align: justify">
          You need to upload your official certificate of English level if you are not a native speaker of English. In this case, the selection committee will contact to you to appoint an interview to verify the level.
         </p>
         <div class="vc_empty_space" style="height: 10px">
          <span class="vc_empty_space_inner">
          </span>
         </div>
         <h6 class="vc_custom_heading vc_custom_1548766806558" style="font-size: 18px;color: #ffffff;line-height: 24px;text-align: left">
          <strong>
           Academic Information
          </strong>
         </h6>
         <p class="vc_custom_heading vc_custom_1548767060574" style="font-size: 16px;text-align: justify">
          Fill in all the information required.
         </p>
         <p class="vc_custom_heading vc_custom_1548767165365" style="font-size: 16px;text-align: justify">
          In order to
          <strong>
           unify the grades of the different international academic systems
          </strong>
          it is necessary to state the minimum grade to obtain the degree as well as the maximum obtainable. With this information we can apply the Thales' Theorem of similar triangles to convert your grade into an international comparable score. The equation is: NewGrade = NewMin + (OriginalGrade - OldMin) * (NewMax - NewMin) / (OldMax - OldMin).
         </p>
         <p class="vc_custom_heading vc_custom_1548767149126" style="font-size: 16px;text-align: justify">
          You need to
          <strong>
           upload two documents:
          </strong>
          (i) Your official diploma - officially translated into English when necessary - with your transcript of records. (ii) The official document that states the range of the maximun and the minimum grades in your country.
         </p>
         <div class="vc_empty_space" style="height: 10px">
          <span class="vc_empty_space_inner">
          </span>
         </div>
         <h6 class="vc_custom_heading vc_custom_1548766825089" style="font-size: 18px;color: #ffffff;line-height: 24px;text-align: left">
          <strong>
           Experience
          </strong>
         </h6>
         <p class="vc_custom_heading vc_custom_1548767524654" style="font-size: 16px;text-align: justify">
          You need to
          <strong>
           upload two documents:
          </strong>
          (i) Your Curriculum Vitae in the Europass Format; and (ii) A motivation letter where you explain why you want to do this Master's Degree.
         </p>
         <p class="vc_custom_heading vc_custom_1548768103352" style="font-size: 16px;text-align: justify">
          <a href="https://europass.cedefop.europa.eu/documents/curriculum-vitae" target=" _blank">
           <strong>
            Link to the Europass Online Editor for your Curriculum Vitae.
           </strong>
          </a>
         </p>

}

}

}

}

    background: #2e9133;
}

    width: 181px;
}

    display: inline-block;
    font-size: 25px;

    text-align: center;
    padding-top: 9px;

    border-radius: 50%;

    margin-right: 9px;

    margin-bottom: 7px;
}
.wh-menu-main > li:first-child {
    width: auto;
    margin-left: -15px;
}
.wh-menu-main > li:last-child {
    background-color: #ffc600;
    float: right !important;
} 
.wh-menu-main > li:last-child a,
.wh-menu-main > li:last-child a:hover {
    color: #fff;
}

}

}

}

    background: #4caf50;

}

}

.wh-menu-main > li .fa-pencil {
    background: #1d87e4;

}

        <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1537807463578">
         <div class="wpb_wrapper">
          <p style="text-align: justify;">
           PETaL EMJMD
           <strong>
            first semester
           </strong>
           , entitled ‘General Introduction’, will be delivered at the Universidad de Córdoba (Spain). Its main goal is to provide students with the fundamentals of the four areas of expertise included in this EMJMD (that is, the psychology of children play; ECE; IE; and ESLA).
          </p>
          <p style="text-align: justify;">
           PETaL
           <strong>
            second semester courses
           </strong>
           will be delivered at the Instituto Politécnico de Lisboa (Portugal) that will complement and enrich students’ knowledge about the role of play and toys for learning in ECE in different cultures.
          </p>
          <p style="text-align: justify;">
           <strong>
            Third semester courses
           </strong>
           are offered by Marmara University (Turkey), highly specialized in the Sociology of play and children.
          </p>
          <p style="text-align: justify;">
           <strong>
            The fourth semester
           </strong>
           will be devoted to the planning and writing of the Master’s Thesis (30 ECTS), which can take place at any of the three participant Universities in collaboration with the associated partners. A wide range of possible topics is available for MT projects carefully designed to ensure relevant skills and subject training. The list of topics offered will be yearly updated.
          </p>

         <h2 class="vc_custom_heading" style="font-size: 37px;line-height: 44px;text-align: center">
          Scholarship and fees
         </h2>
         <div class="vc_separator wpb_content_element vc_separator_align_center vc_sep_width_100 vc_sep_border_width_4 vc_sep_pos_align_center vc_separator_no_text">
          <span class="vc_sep_holder vc_sep_holder_l">

          </span>
          <span class="vc_sep_holder vc_sep_holder_r">
           <span class="vc_sep_line" style="border-color:#f8a724;">
           </span>
          </span>
         </div>
         <div class="wpb_single_image wpb_content_element vc_align_left">
          <figure class="wpb_wrapper vc_figure">
           <a class="vc_single_image-wrapper vc_box_border_grey" href="https://web.em-petal.eu/application-process" target="_self">
            <img alt="" class="vc_single_image-img attachment-full" height="497" sizes="(max-width: 897px) 100vw, 897px" src="https://web.em-petal.eu/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/logo-petal-sin-partners-lateral.png" srcset="https://web.em-petal.eu/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/logo-petal-sin-partners-lateral.png 897w, https://web.em-petal.eu/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/logo-petal-sin-partners-lateral-300x166.png 300w" width="897"/>
           </a>
          </figure>
         </div>
         <div class="wpb_single_image wpb_content_element vc_align_left vc_custom_1538042574347">
          <figure class="wpb_wrapper vc_figure">
           <a class="vc_single_image-wrapper vc_box_border_grey" href="https://web.em-petal.eu/application-process" target="_self">
            <img alt="" class="vc_single_image-img attachment-full" height="271" src="https://web.em-petal.eu/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/erasmus_plus.png" width="258"/>
           </a>
          </figure>

        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-9">
       <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1603293621744">
        <div class="wpb_wrapper">
         <h4 class="vc_custom_heading" style="text-align: left">
          PETaL EMJMD Participation Costs
         </h4>
         <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1581437270191">
          <div class="wpb_wrapper">
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            <strong>
             Scholarship applications for every intake will open on 15 September, with the Application for the Programme.
            </strong>
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1603293811781">
          <div class="wpb_wrapper">
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            The participation costs for Erasmus Mundus scholarship holders will be fully covered by the EM scholarship.
           </p>
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            Individuals who have already benefited from an EM Master Course scholarship are not eligible for a second scholarship in order to follow the same or another EM Master Course.
           </p>
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            Students will be provided with access to the facilities of the partner universities (library, PC rooms, e-mail and Internet) as well as to the universities’ cafeterias and restaurants at student rates.
           </p>
           <p>
           </p>
           <table>
            <tbody>
             <tr>
              <td colspan="3">
               <strong>
                Description of components of Erasmus Mundus scholarships
               </strong>
              </td>
             </tr>
             <tr>
              <td width="40%">
              </td>
              <td width="30%">
               <strong>
                For scholarship holders from Erasmus+ Programme countries*.
               </strong>
              </td>
              <td width="30%">
               <strong>
                For scholarship holders from Erasmus+ Partner countries*.
               </strong>
              </td>
             </tr>
             <tr>
              <td rowspan="2">
               Contribution to the
               <strong>
                participation costs (directly reimbursed from the scholarship)
               </strong>
              </td>
              <td>
               <strong>
                up to 4.500 € per year
               </strong>
               per scholarship holder.
              </td>
              <td>
               <strong>
                up to 9.000 € per year
               </strong>
               per scholarship holder.
              </td>
             </tr>
             <tr>
              <td colspan="2">
               Any amount in excess of these maximum contributions must be covered by the participating organisations and cannot be charged to the scholarship holder.
              </td>
             </tr>
             <tr>
              <td>
               Contribution to the
               <strong>
                travel and installation costs
               </strong>
              </td>
              <td>
               <strong>
                Travel costs:
               </strong>
               <p>
                <strong>
                 1.000 € per year per scholarship holder
                </strong>
                resident of a Programme Country.
               </p>
              </td>
              <td>
               <strong>
                Travel costs:
               </strong>
               <ul>
                <li>
                 <strong>
                  2.000 € per year
                 </strong>
                 per scholarship holder resident of a Partner Country whose location is
                 <strong>
                  less than 4.000 km away from the coordinator (UCO).
                 </strong>
                </li>
                <li>
                 <strong>
                  3.000 € per year
                 </strong>
                 per scholarship holder resident of a Partner Country whose location is
                 <strong>
                  4.000 km or more away from the coordinator (UCO).
                 </strong>
                </li>
               </ul>
               <p>
                <strong>
                 Installation costs:
                </strong>
               </p>
               <p>
                <strong>
                 1.000 € per scholarship holder
                </strong>
                resident of a Partner Country.
               </p>
              </td>
             </tr>
             <tr>
              <td>
               Contribution to
               <strong>
                subsistence costs
               </strong>
              </td>
              <td colspan="2">
               <strong>
                1.000 € per month (24 months maximum)
               </strong>
               <p>
                Contribution to subsistence costs
                <strong>
                 will not be given to scholarship holders for the periods spent in their country of residence.
                </strong>
               </p>
              </td>
             </tr>
            </tbody>
           </table>
           <p>
            * More details about Erasmus+ Programme Countries and Partner Countries can be found in the
            <strong>
             <a href="http://ec.europa.eu/programmes/erasmus-plus/documents/erasmus-plus-programme-guide_en.pdf" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
              Erasmus+ Programme Guide (pp. 24-25)
             </a>
             .
            </strong>
           </p>
           <p>
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             Last updated 30 September 2020.
            </em>
           </p>

         <h4 class="vc_custom_heading" style="text-align: left">
          Erasmus Mundus student scholarships
         </h4>
         <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1581437270191">
          <div class="wpb_wrapper">
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            <strong>
             Scholarship applications for every intake will open on 15 September, with the Application for the Programme.
            </strong>
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1581437332977">
          <div class="wpb_wrapper">
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            EMJMD student scholarships can be offered to students from any region of the world. The scholarships’ terms depend on the student’s country of origin/residence.
            <strong>
             Scholarship holders must state that they will not be doubly funded for the same period.
            </strong>
            <strong>
             You must submit a declaration on oath.
            </strong>
           </p>
           <p style="text-align: justify;">
            The EMJMD student scholarship includes:
           </p>
           <ul>
            <li style="text-align: justify;">
             A contribution to the student participation costs (including tuition fees, full
             <strong>
              insurance coverage
             </strong>
             and any other mandatory costs related to the students’ participation in the EMJMD study programme.
            </li>
            <li style="text-align: justify;">
             A contribution to student travel and installation costs.
            </li>
            <li style="text-align: justify;">
             A monthly subsistence allowance for the entire duration of the EMJMD study programme.
            </li>
           </ul>
           <p>
            <strong>
             <span class="mceNonEditable">
             </span>
            </strong>
           </p>
           <table border="1">
            <tbody>
             <tr>
              <td style="text-align: center;">
               Contribution to the participation costs
              </td>
              <td>
               Up to 4,500 € per year per scholarship holder from a Programme Country.
               <p>
                Up to 9,000 € per year per scholarship holder from a Partner Country.
               </p>
               <p>
                Any amount in excess of these maximum contributions must be covered by the participating organisations and cannot be charged to the scholarship holder.
               </p>
              </td>
             </tr>
             <tr>
              <td style="text-align: center;">
               Contribution to the travel and installation costs
              </td>
              <td>
               1,000 € per year per scholarship holder
               <strong>
                resident
               </strong>
               of a Programme country.
               <p>
                2,000 € per year for travel costs + 1,000 € for installation costs for a scholarship holder
                <strong>
                 resident
                </strong>
                in a Partner country whose location is situated at less than 4,000 km from the EMJMD coordinating HEI.
               </p>
               <p>
                3,000 € per year for travel costs + 1,000 € for installation costs for a scholarship
                <strong>
                 resident
                </strong>
                in a Partner country whose location is situated at 4.000km or more from the EMJMD coordinating HEI.
               </p>
               <p>
                Distance is calculated by the Consortium using the
                <strong>
                 EACEA calculator
                </strong>
                (available below).
               </p>
              </td>
             </tr>
             <tr>
              <td style="text-align: center;">
               Contribution to subsistence costs
              </td>
              <td>
               1,000 € per month for the entire duration of the EMJMD study programme (24 months maximum).
               <p>
                Contribution to subsistence costs will
                <strong>
                 not
                </strong>
                be given to scholarship holders for the periods of the EMJMD (study / research / placement / thesis preparation) spent in their country of residence.
               </p>
               <p>
                Contribution to subsistence costs will
                <strong>
                 not
                </strong>
                be given to Partner Country scholarship holders for periods exceeding 3 months spent in any Partner Country.
               </p>
              </td>
             </tr>
            </tbody>
           </table>
           <p>
            <em>
             Last updated 11 February 2020.
            </em>
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
